intro: Keetia transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal keetia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are leathery and elliptical, with a glossy surface. Keetia transvaalensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
